detailedRequirements:
This challenge is to built an awesome Custom Visualforce UI to create a Project (Custom Object) and Associated applications and properties. (Custom Objects.).

Application uses the below hierarchy

 

Project Object

  • Project ID (auto-generated index consisting of a “P” followed by 6 numerical characters, example: “P012345”)
  • Project Name (free text field, max. 60 alphanumeric characters, mandatory)
  • Project Start Date
  • Project End Date
  • Business Owner ((lookup field, possible values are all users from the internal user groups; mandatory)
  • IT PM (lookup field, possible values are all users from the IT PM user group, mandatory)
  • Region (picklist field, possible values APAC, EAG, EG, LAG, NAG, Global; mandatory)
  • Business Unit (picklist field; possible values Division A, Division B, Division C mandatory)
  • Country (Picklist Field; mandatory)
  • Brand (Picklist field, values: BrandA, BrandB, Brand C, etc.; value list should be able to be edited by Admin role, mandatory)

Use Standard Attachments.

  • Attachments (need to be able to add files to a Project record. File types to be able to attached include MS Word, MS Excel, MS Powerpoint, JPEG, PNG, PDF, mobile app source code files, … but if more file types can be added, that is considered a plus)

Application Object

  • Application ID (auto-generated index consisting of 6 numeric characters)
  • Application Name (free text field, max. 60 alphanumeric characters,
  • mandatory)
  • Application Type (Picklist fields Web App, Social App, Mobile App, Enterprise App, mandatory)
  • Application Category (picklist field, Category 1, Category 2, Category 3 mandatory)
  • Target Launch Date (date field, can only be date equal to or later than
  • current date, mandatory)
  • Target Sunset Date (date field, can only be equal to or later than Target
  • Launch Date, mandatory)
  • Lifecycle Stage bar (values: Kick-Off, Design, Review, Development, Testing,
  • Live, Sunset)

Add 5 custom Technology fields for each Application Type, like below.

  • Web App Tech 1
  • Web App Tech 2
  • Web App Tech 3
  • Web App Tech 4
  • Web App Tech 5

Add 5 custom Security fields for each Application Type like below.

  • Web App Security 1
  • Web App Security 2
  • Web App Security 3
  • Web App Security 4
  • Web App Security 5

Property Object

  • Property ID (auto-generated index consisting of application ID, followed by “-“ and the 3 digits for the property identification, example “007532-001”)
  • Unique Property Title for Analytics Tools (free text field, 50 characters)
  • Production URL
  • Trademark
  • Country
  • Language
  • Status
  • Property Analytics Name
  • URL listed in Google Analytics
  • Google Tag Manager Container code
  • Google Tag Manager Account
  • Google Analytics UA Code
  • Webtrends DCS ID
  • Target Launch Date
  • Target Sunset Date
  • Does this property span multiple domains? (if yes, please attach list of URLs)
  • Does this property span multiple sub-domains? (if yes, please attach list of URLs)
  • Does your homepage default name differ from “index.html”? (if yes please attach)
  • Will your application have a paid search campaign through Google Adwords?
  • Will your application have a paid search campaign through Google AdSense?
  • Property Type (Technology, Security)

UI Requirements

 

When filling out the project or application record for the first time, the entry screen(s) should be set up in a way that feels like the user is “telling a story”, whereby the most basic information is provided on the first screen. The next screen(s) will collect more specific information each time displaying fields to be completed, based on information collected on the previous screen. These “first entry screens” will each contain a considerable amount of clarification to guide the user through the process and to ensure he/she fills out the correct information. See flowchart below as clarification.

Once all the required information has been filled out on the application record to complete the “Design” stage, the application will be submitted to IT PM approval and Business Owner approval. The application will now be in the “Review” phase and the application record can only be edited by a IT PM and the Admin.

 

 

Below screens are just samples, you can create your own screens that make more sense. Screens must be simple to use and they must be  “Story based” UI’s.  Feel free to change as necessary.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Additional UI Considerations

  • Try to use Bootstrap or any other responsive UI methodology
  • For any fields that you display on the UI, use Fieldsets or custom settings that can be configurable in future (adding or removing fields to screens)
  • All the headings, titles can be setup as Custom Labels
  • Follow the best practices when creating the Visualforce pages

All the above points are considerations and not requirements, if you think you have better approaches and designs, we are open to them as well.

For the screen mockups look at the attached word document in assets
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
*** Code Best Practices that we expect you to follow:

  • Unit and System Testing. Unit tests must be developed as part of the challenge, above 80% coverage for all new classes written is required.

  • Code Aesthetics. Code must be clean (no commented code fragments, unused variables etc), tidy (4 space indents) and well commented. Use of Contest/Challenge names in comments instead of developer names. Utilising good clear and purposeful naming for variables, classes etc. Employ the use of Constants or enumerations where ever required. API methods should reside in the Service layer and not in the controller.

  • Scalability - This solution is the first in the series of many, so we would like you to ensure this is designed with scalability in mind. The Code needs to be readable and maintenable.

  • Volume Requirements - We need the search page to be designed with View state barriers in mind, and also its ability to cater to large Product Inventory volumes.

  • UX��� - We have suggested mockups and reference URL for guidelines, however, a solution with an innovative suggestion is desired.

  • This Solution will need to be a Production quality asset.

  • Your Submission should Include all Code elements for the Salesforce code, static resources and metadata elements. Please provide an unmanaged package of the same.

  • Video Demo should present the application functionality end to end and overview of the application codeblocks.

  • Demo the Submission with :

    • Featuring the Config steps if any

    • Organized Code walkthrough

    • Demonstrating the Test execution (positive and negative tests) and coverage

    • Demonstrating all functionality

  • A Final Documentation that Covers Deploy/Install, Configure for the solution.
